      • getRecord

        public RECORD getRecord​(long id,
                        RECORD record,
                        RecordLoad load,
                        PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Description copied from interface: RecordStore
        Reads a record from the store into target. Depending on RecordLoad given there will be different behavior, although the target record will be marked with the specified id after participating in this method call.
        • RecordLoad.CHECK: As little data as possible is read to determine whether the record is in use or not. If not in use then no more data will be loaded into the target record and the data of the record will be cleared.
        • RecordLoad.NORMAL: Just like RecordLoad.CHECK, but with the difference that an InvalidRecordException will be thrown if the record isn't in use.
        • RecordLoad.FORCE: The entire contents of the record will be loaded into the target record regardless if the record is in use or not. This leaves no guarantees about the data in the record after this method call, except that the id will be the specified id.
        • RecordLoad.ALWAYS: Similar to RecordLoad.FORCE, except the sanity checks on the record data is always enabled.
        Specified by:
        getRecord in interface RecordStore<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>
        Overrides:
        getRecord in class RecordStore.Delegator<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the record to load.
        record - record where data will be loaded into. This record will have its id set to the specified id as part of this method call.
        load - loading behaviour, read more in method description.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer.
        Returns:
        the record that was passed in, for convenience.
